image.altText: SA Liberal MP Jing Lee at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Jing Lee is the latest MP to have left the ranks of the SA Liberals, and while her former colleagues have been much kinder about her resignation than about those of some of her predecessors, the party is becoming all too familiar with defections.

title.children: Jing Lee's defection is the latest in a long line by SA Liberals

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A South Australian man has been arrested after trying to evade police by swimming into the ocean following a high-speed pursuit through Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Driver swims into ocean to evade police following high-speed pursuit

image.altText: A great white shark looking at the camera almost looking like its smiling with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: While scientists say increasing electronic monitoring of white sharks across South Australia's coastline could help warn beachgoers of imminent danger, the state government has other ideas.

title.children: Could expanding acoustic tagging of sharks in SA help save lives?

image.altText: A man wearing a cowboy hat and blue shirt leans against a gate

props.synopsis: Long before motorbikes were used for mustering, Ron Woodall had been breaking in horses on stations. He has spent his life in the world of bucking bulls and broncs, becoming a legend in the rodeo community.

title.children: Rodeo legend notches up 70 years among the toughest broncs and bulls

image.altText: Elizabeth Dalman spreads her arms wide as she stands in front of ADT dancers

props.synopsis: Modern dance pioneer and rebel Elizabeth Dalman is returning to her roots in a new production by a leading Australian arts company.

title.children: 90-year-old rebel with a cause returns for new dance show

image.altText: Bike crash at the Tour Down Under

props.synopsis: A New South Wales woman is in hospital after suffering significant injuries while watching the prelude to the men's race at the Tour Down Under.

title.children: Female spectator suffers serious injuries after cyclists crash into safety barriers

image.altText: A plume of sediment over a coastline with cliffs in the background.

props.synopsis: The EPA says a layer of clay was unexpectedly uncovered during works to raise a seawall south of Adelaide, which released a sediment plume into the water.

title.children: Sediment plume interrupts Christies Beach seawall works

image.altText: Young girl smiling and painting

props.synopsis: When Jung Yoon moved to Australia from South Korea in 1995, she had never encountered a person with a disability before, but that changed when she had her daughter Joanne. Now she is dedicating her life to help people with cognitive disability have better employment opportunities.

title.children: Inclusive hiring at the heart of project for people with cognitive impairment

image.altText: Trump wears a red striped tie and black woolen trench coat. He has a stern expression as he looks to the side

props.synopsis: Donald Trump lands in Washington, DC ahead of a pre-inauguration rally. Follow live.

title.children: Donald Trump to hold rally on eve of inauguration

image.altText: A black and white image of a man in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Late civil rights leader Marcus Garvey is one of five people Joe Biden has pardoned the day before Donald Trump's inauguration.

title.children: Biden pardons civil rights leader Marcus Garvey posthumously

image.altText: A woman holds a hot water bottle against her stomach.

props.synopsis: A new study has found almost four in five Australian women have experienced problematic periods in the past five years, and almost half of those have missed days of work or study, costing about $14 billion a year in lost productivity.

title.children: Periods in spotlight as research highlights personal and economic cost

image.altText: Photo of health service sign

props.synopsis: A group of doctors outraged by last year's abortion ban at Orange hospital in regional NSW say they have lodged a complaint with the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: 'We are heartbroken and incensed': Doctors demand action after Orange abortion ban

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: The father of a deceased newborn baby at the centre of a criminal neglect case told police in a recorded interview he had accidentally knocked over a bassinet.

title.children: Newborn had injuries consistent with 'high-impact car crash', court hears

image.altText: The cycling path along Adelaide's Southern Expressway.

props.synopsis: A South Australian teen has appeared in court after allegedly stringing fencing wire on a bike path — but he says he's innocent.

title.children: Teen denies twice setting wire traps on bike path despite alleged video

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks on during his Australian Open third round match.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur is bidding to reach his first Australian Open quarterfinal, however, talented Alex Michelsen isn't going to make his assignment easy.

title.children: De Minaur aiming for Aus Open first but lanky American stands in his way

image.altText: Novak Djokovic grabs the microphone from Jim Courier

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic has said he will avoid doing interviews on court at the Australian Open until he receives an apology from the Nine Network, after reporter Tony Jones's "mockery of Serbian fans".

title.children: 'Mockery of Serbian fans': Djokovic protests against Channel Nine after reporter's broadcast

image.altText: A woman with dark hair against a white background

props.synopsis: As the mystery and intrigue deepen, millions of Indians want to know: What hope is there, truly, that Nimisha Priya might be spared?

title.children: An Indian nurse killed a man in Yemen. His family will determine her fate

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Two leading lawyers and a juror reveal what goes on behind the scenes of a high-profile murder trial, as Victoria's Supreme Court prepares for the Erin Patterson triple-murder case later this year.

title.children: 'Did she do it?': Jurors to answer key question of the mushroom cook case

image.altText: Stuart O'Grady sits out the top of a team car

props.synopsis: Stuart O'Grady says despite all his race wins and Olympic, world and Commonwealth gold medals, welcoming the world's top UCI pro cyclists to his backyard for the Tour Down Under is his proudest moment.

title.children: Why running the Tour Down Under is Stuart O'Grady's proudest achievement

image.altText: A big red-brown rock in front of a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in western Victoria say a draft management plan for Mt Arapiles-Tooan State Park has re-ignited racial abuse and harassment of Aboriginal people online and in the community.

title.children: Aboriginal people say Mt Arapiles climbing ban has sparked racist backlash

image.altText: A rusted out shipwreck in the ocean with a small island in the background

props.synopsis: HMAS Protector, crumbling offshore of Heron Island, played an important part in Australia's naval history and is now a marine paradise providing security for fish, turtles, rays, and sharks.

title.children: HMAS Protector, bought for just 10 pounds, now a marine paradise off Heron Island

image.altText: A newborn turtle is held in someone's hand.

props.synopsis: A new online tool will help conservationist share and compare novel solutions to climate threats. Its founders hope it will inspire innovation and optimism amid grim global warming metrics.

title.children: As climate warms, there's hope a new project will inspire solutions

image.altText: Rain falls over a dry red plain.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain is predicted for the Pilbara as a cyclone forms off WA. Weather authorities are warning coastal communities from Port Hedland to Exmouth could be facing strong winds and heavy rain for the next few days.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Sean warning upgraded as it travels down WA coast

image.altText: The Tomago aluminium plant near Newcastle.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor will offer billions of dollars in production credits to support a new "green aluminium" sector, in a new election pitch.

title.children: Albanese government promises $2 billion for new 'green aluminium' sector

image.altText: Wappa Falls on the Sunshine Coast where a man drowned on January 2, 2022. A warning sign can be seen.

props.synopsis: Police say a 17-year-old girl fell at Wappa Falls on Sunday afternoon and a 17-year-old boy who jumped into the water to find her also died.

title.children: Two teens dead after one falls at waterfall and the other tries to rescue her

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Steve Smith holds his bat and prepares to bat for the Sydney Sixers

props.synopsis: Stand-in Australian skipper Steve Smith has picked up an elbow injury in the Big Bash but is still planning to head to Sri Lanka for the upcoming Test tour.

title.children: Steve Smith plans to fight on through elbow injury in Sri Lanka

image.altText: two men holding a scout drone which is part of a research project for the anu to find new ways to fight fires

props.synopsis: With wildfires raging across Los Angeles, focus is turning to how new technologies, including AI, can aid our response to future disasters,. But there are concerns Australia isn't ready to combat fires all year round.

title.children: How Australia fights bushfires could soon look very different, but is it too late?

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz looks annoyed, holding his head in his hands with a towel

props.synopsis: The US ban of TikTok has some feeling glum, while a hot-temper in the Aussie heat has burnt a hole in Medvedev's pocket. Here are the five quick hits from day eight of the Australian Open.

title.children: Quick hits: 'Crazy' clocks, TikTok turmoil and racquet smashing fines

image.altText: A group of four men take a selfie.

props.synopsis: The country's most popular youth radio station first hit the airwaves in 1975 as Double J, and is now reflecting on five decades of thrilling its audience, annoying its critics, and celebrating Australian music.

title.children: 'An extraordinary achievement': Triple j celebrates 50 years on air

image.altText: Women wear red traditional beaded ethnic dress and take selfie with phone.

props.synopsis: By scaling back its independent fact-checking, Meta has triggered alarm among civil society groups in Asia where misinformation's consequences have proven deadly.

title.children: 'Dangerous times ahead': Warnings of misinformation surge as Meta retreats

image.altText: People in a chairlift look up at rescuers dangling from cable above them

props.synopsis: A chairlift collapses at a winter resort in the Pyrenees mountains in the north of Spain, injuring dozens and leaving skiers stranded.

title.children: Skiers 'thrown off' chairlift during accident at Spanish resort

image.altText: A pregnant woman receives her COVID-19 shot in Pennsylvania, January 2021.

props.synopsis: RSV is a highly infectious virus that is the most common cause of respiratory infections in children.

title.children: What to know about RSV and the free vaccine coming in February

image.altText: A black and silver book with the title Onyx Storm featuring dragon motifs cut out against a lilac and pink background.

props.synopsis: The third book in the bestselling Empyrean series is finally out tomorrow, but not everyone has bought into the Fourth Wing hype. What can we expect from Onyx Storm and is there anything to the criticism of the series and its author, Rebecca Yarros?

title.children: Equal parts popular and controversial, the next Fourth Wing book is almost here
